page.title: 01Westing (Mainly South) Unst
page.content:
This westerly section of Britain's beautiful northernmost island has much variety of scenery, colour, wildlife, particularly birds, flowers; historic and antiquarian interests.
Situated on Lat.60N, as far north as Siberia and Iceland. Atlantic waters bringing warm Gulf Stream currents maintain a temperate climate.
The broad inlet features sand dunes and marshland. Westward the exposed coastline fronts a vast seascape - open ocean surging direct to the frozen Arctic.
Bright green (limestone based) vegetation marks the scattered croft- lands - predominantly stock-rearing.
